review: works really well. I was using WD digital player which needs a ethernet cable to be routed to the device. Problem is that my router is elsewhere in my home so routing cable became near to impossible task for me. Now with fire stick, all clutters are gone. Just stick it in the HDMI port and it is able to connect wirelessly to my router and I am able to enjoy all the apps which was present in WD streaming player.

review: Works a lot better than our older Samsung Blue-Ray/DVD player.  It rarely has the pauses and skips we had while watching MLB.com games.  I also like the fact you don't have to point the remote at the TV to make it change.
author: Bryan

review: Very easy to set up and use. I have used the Fire Stick on two different TV's and while traveling (through captive portal access feature) in a motel. The IU is user friendly, and in some ways I prefer it to the Roku Stick I also have; plus the extra channels available on Roku are ones I am not really interested in anyway. I also appreciate the thought that went into the device itself, including the packaging. Features, design, simplicity, quality look and feel all add up to a great device which is one piece of the puzzle of leaving cable behind, or at least reducing service to basic for those channels which are difficult to find elsewhere. Five Stars!
author: John P.
